educational_objective: Identify a prior inferior myocardial infarction on ECG.
question_text: A 58-year-old woman is evaluated before elective total hip arthroplasty.ECG is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following abnormalities is seen on this patient's ECG?
critique: This ECG shows evidence of a prior inferior myocardial infarction (Option D), with Q waves in leads II, III, and aVF without ST-segment changes. There are no ECG changes consistent with acute pericarditis (diffuse upsloping ST-segment elevations with PR-segment depression), nor are there ECG changes suggesting prior anterior myocardial infarction (Q waves in the anterior leads) or Brugada syndrome (coved ST-segment elevation).

figures.title: ECG Showing Prior Inferior Myocardial Infarction
figures.short_title: stem ECG Showing Prior Inferior Myocardial Infarction
